column1: For the district in Costa Rica
column2: see Corralillo District.Corralillo is a municipality and town in the Villa Clara Province of Cuba. It was founded in 1831 and established as a municipality in 1879.

column1: Corralillo is located on the northern coast of Cuba
column2: in the north-western corner of the Villa Clara province
column3: bordering the Matanzas Province to the west and the Bay of Cadiz to the north. The cays of Falcones
column4: Blanquizal and Verde of the Sabana-Camagüey Archipelago as well as a multitude of reefs are located at sea north of Corralillo.

column1: The municipality is divided into the consejos populares (mainly villages) of Ceja de Pablo

column2: the municipality of Corralillo had a population of 27
column3: 581. With a total area of 843 km2 (325 sq mi)
column4: it has a population density of 32.7/km2 (85/sq mi).
